title: Chinese CGC donates 200,000 Rs. to Sri Lanka for floods and landslides relief (Linked to project #54310)
description: On June 13th, 2016, Chinese state-owned China Geo-Engineering Corporation (CGC) donated Rs. 200,000 to Sri Lanka for flood and landslide relief. CGC's Deputy General Manager Shu Dehua handed over the cheque to S. S Miyanawala, the secretary of Ministry of Disaster Management. CGC made another donation of Rs. 500,000 relief aid to Sri Lanka in June, 2017. #54310
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese CGC donates 200,000 Rs. to Sri Lanka for floods and landslides relief (Linked to project #54310)

# Description
On June 13th, 2016, Chinese state-owned China Geo-Engineering Corporation (CGC) donated Rs. 200,000 to Sri Lanka for flood and landslide relief. CGC's Deputy General Manager Shu Dehua handed over the cheque to S. S Miyanawala, the secretary of Ministry of Disaster Management. CGC made another donation of Rs. 500,000 relief aid to Sri Lanka in June, 2017. #54310
justification: Project is a humanitarian donation for disaster relief with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation for flood and landslide relief, no infrastructure or energy components mentioned

title: Chinese Government provides grant for China-Sri Lanka Friendship Primary School in Yatagampitiya (linked to #71768)
description: In October 2016, a grant to reconstruct China-Sri Lanka Friendship Primary School in Yatagampitiya was provided by the Chinese government through the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka. On July 5, 2018, a ceremony was held to celebrate the completion of the reconstruction.   China Machinery Engineering Co., Ltd undertook the reconstruction project and also donated educational supplies such as computers and school equipment (captured in #71768). The school is also known as the Faxian Shicun School.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government provides grant for China-Sri Lanka Friendship Primary School in Yatagampitiya (linked to #71768)

# Description
In October 2016, a grant to reconstruct China-Sri Lanka Friendship Primary School in Yatagampitiya was provided by the Chinese government through the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka. On July 5, 2018, a ceremony was held to celebrate the completion of the reconstruction.   China Machinery Engineering Co., Ltd undertook the reconstruction project and also donated educational supplies such as computers and school equipment (captured in #71768). The school is also known as the Faxian Shicun School.
justification: Project is focused on educational infrastructure development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: School reconstruction, educational supplies donation, no energy-related components mentioned

title: China Development Bank provides $65 million loan for AVIC Astoria Tower One Project
description: In 2013, AVIC International Hotels Lanka Ltd. [中航国际酒店(斯里兰卡)有限公司] — a special purpose vehicle and joint venture of AVIC International Engineering (Hong Kong) Limited and Nice View Investment Ltd of Hong Kong — entered into a supplementary agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka’s Board of Investment (BOI) under Strategic Development Act to undertake an apartment complex including 528 apartment units, a clubhouse, commercial space and car parking facility at R A De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03 with an envisaged investment of $250 million. AVIC International Hotels Lanka Ltd. and China Development Bank subsequently signed a $65 million loan agreement for the AVIC Astoria Tower One Project. The purpose of the project was to construct four 41-story towers — in a construction area of 144,358 square meters — with 608 apartments that are separated into 2, 3 and 4 bedroom units in Colombo 03, a residential and commercial region of the capital city of Colombo. China State Construction Engineering Corporation Limited (CSCEC) is the contractor responsible for project implementation. The project was officially launched on December 21, 2016.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the AVIC Astoria Project. The Chinese project title is 斯里兰卡Astoria公寓. 2. Aviation Industry Corporation of China (AVIC) is a state-owned mega incorporation administrated by the Chinese government. 3. Evidence of a $65 million loan from CDB can be found here (0https://www.dropbox.com/s/rfilib6i1yo2owu/JT%26N%20%E9%87%91%E8%AF%9A%E5%90%8C%E8%BE%BE%E5%BE%8B%E5%B8%88%E4%BA%8B%E5%8A%A1%E6%89%80.pdf?dl=0). 4. AVIC International Hotels Lanka Ltd. [中航国际酒店(斯里兰卡)有限公司] is also known as M/s AVIC International Hotels Lanka (Pvt) Ltd. 5. The loan commitment date is unknown. For the time being, AidData uses the project implementation start date as a proxy for the loan commitment date. This issue warrants further investigation.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER MULTISECTOR

# Title
China Development Bank provides $65 million loan for AVIC Astoria Tower One Project

# Description
In 2013, AVIC International Hotels Lanka Ltd. [中航国际酒店(斯里兰卡)有限公司] — a special purpose vehicle and joint venture of AVIC International Engineering (Hong Kong) Limited and Nice View Investment Ltd of Hong Kong — entered into a supplementary agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka’s Board of Investment (BOI) under Strategic Development Act to undertake an apartment complex including 528 apartment units, a clubhouse, commercial space and car parking facility at R A De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03 with an envisaged investment of $250 million. AVIC International Hotels Lanka Ltd. and China Development Bank subsequently signed a $65 million loan agreement for the AVIC Astoria Tower One Project. The purpose of the project was to construct four 41-story towers — in a construction area of 144,358 square meters — with 608 apartments that are separated into 2, 3 and 4 bedroom units in Colombo 03, a residential and commercial region of the capital city of Colombo. China State Construction Engineering Corporation Limited (CSCEC) is the contractor responsible for project implementation. The project was officially launched on December 21, 2016.
justification: Project is a residential and commercial development with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Apartment complex with 608 units, clubhouse, commercial space, and parking facilities; no mention of energy or environmental features

title: China National Aero-technology International Engineering Corporation (AVIC-ENG) donates Rs 300,000 worth of essential supplies to Lawris Girls’ Home in 2016
description: In April, 2016, the China National Aero-technology International Engineering Corporation (AVIC-ENG) donated Rs 300,000 worth of essential supplies to the Lawris Girls’ Home in Colombo as a part of its "Raise the Future with Love" campaign. The donation consisted of food, supplies, stationary, cooking utensils, and other essential items. This donation was AVIC-ENG's third yearly donation to Lawris Girls’ Home since 2014.  The Lawris Girls’ Home was founded by the wife of famous Sri Lankan educationalist and former principal of Nalanda College, D.C. Lawris. Since its establishment, the home has adopted and provided a caring abode for orphaned children.
combined_text:

The donation consisted of food, supplies, stationary, cooking utensils, and other essential items. This donation was AVIC-ENG's third yearly donation to Lawris Girls’ Home since 2014.  The Lawris Girls’ Home was founded by the wife of famous Sri Lankan educationalist and former principal of Nalanda College, D.C. Lawris. Since its establishment, the home has adopted and provided a caring abode for orphaned children.
justification: Project involves donation of essential supplies to an orphanage, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of food, supplies, stationary, cooking utensils to Lawris Girls’ Home, part of social welfare campaign

title: Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka and China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC) donate 300 sets of pencil cases and backpacks to Fa-Hsien GALA Sri-Lanka-China Friendship Village School
description: On November 10, 2016, the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka and China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC) donated a total of 300 sets of pencil cases and backpacks to the Fa-Hsien GALA Sri-Lanka-China Friendship Village School in Kalutara. On November 10, Chinese Ambassador Yi Xianliang visited the school to donate the materials. During the visit, three scholarships from CMEC totaling Rs 30,000 were donated to the school. (captured via project ID #98678)  Fa-Hsien GALA Sri-Lanka-China Friendship Village School is a rural school in Kalutara, 40 km south of the capital Colombo, located near the Fa-Hien caves. The financial value of the donation is unknown.

title: China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC) donates scholarships totaling Rs 30,000 to students at Fa-Hsien GALA Sri-Lanka-China Friendship Village School in 2016

title: Asia Pacific Daily donates to Sri Lanka Ministry of Disaster Management following 2016 floods
description: In May, 2016, Asia Pacific Daily donated an unknown amount of funds to the Sri Lanka Ministry of Disaster Management following extreme flooding in Sri Lanka. At least 102 people were killed in the floods. The disaster was recorded as one of the worst in Sri Lanka's history.
staff_comments: 1. Asia Pacific Daily is a branch of the Chinese state-controlled Xinhua News Agency.

evidence: Donation to Ministry of Disaster Management for flood response, humanitarian focus
